TopicTitle: By the tips of my teeth

Articles.Content:
So, after jeb flew a fantastic landing on the Mun, and a great return, he had to re-enter. He placed his periapsis at 28K, what, at the time, he thought was a safe altitude. As he barreled into the atmosphere, going close to 3,000 m/s, he realized he made a huge mis-calculation... As his ablator burned away in a wink, he made his final prayers. But it turned he didn't have to, He survived... barely..

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/1YKRg)

0.01, What a close call!
Wow. If it happened to me I'd be shaking and nervous the whole way through.
Did you switch the temperature bars off? Because if not, that means there was a bunch of the capsule's own thermal capacity to survive.

> 
> Did you switch the temperature bars off? Because if not, that means there was a bunch of the capsule's own thermal capacity to survive.

yeah, i keep the temp bars off. I personally dont like all the little bars pinging around on my screen.

> 
> So, after jeb flew a fantastic landing on the Mun, and a great return, he had to re-enter. He placed his periapsis at 28K, what, at the time, he thought was a safe altitude. As he barreled into the atmosphere, going close to 3,000 m/s, he realized he made a huge mis-calculation... As his ablator burned away in a wink, he made his final prayers. But it turned he didn't have to, He survived... barely..

> 0.01, What a close call!

Yeah, OK, but I cannot take my eyes off the typo, dude... sorry...

> 
> ALL HAIL THE NATION. THE PROCRASTINANTION NATION.

all hail the nation. the PROCRASTINATION nation < correct spelling!

I am merely picking out a flaw in your signature because I hate you... my Jeb did not survive re-entry. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Seriously, that is one lucky kerbal you have there. If you can rename him, change it to "lucky"
